title.narrative: Petites subventions pour l'exécution d'activités novatrices de recherche et de mise en commun des connaissances 2014-2015
Small Grants for Innovative Research and Knowledge-Sharing 2014-2015

description.narrative: This project will allow IDRC's Canadian Partnerships program to respond to requests from local, regional, national, and international organizations based in Canada that are engaged in producing and using innovative research for development. It will contribute to IDRC's efforts to improve Canadians' understanding of global development issues and increase the knowledge and skills to address them, both in Canada and in low-income countries. Supporting Canada's response to global issues The project has four key objectives: -support Canadian institutions in their efforts to strengthen and undertake innovative research and knowledge-based activities that have the potential to inform policy and practice in Canada and in low- and middle-income countries; -foster collaboration in research for development in order to increase the potential for greater reach and impact; -encourage activities which emphasize learning: self-monitoring and assessment, sharing learning with others, and seeking insights from others' experiences; and -provide a flexible instrument outside competitive calls to respond quickly to worthwhile opportunities.
